updated_cases.title: Verify sending traffic to match 2 DEIP policy with 2 footprints with same user and app
updated_cases.custom_steps:
- Create tenant_footprint.json with two footprint both enabled
- Create DEIP policy with 
   User:testuser@netskope.com
   Domain:ifconfig.me
   "egress_ip_type": dedicated, footprint-1
- Create DEIP policy with 
   User:testuser@netskope.com
   Domain:ifconfig.me
   "egress_ip_type": dedicated, footprint-2
- Send traffic to match DEIP policy
- Check that the first policy is match and we see DEIP of footprint-1
updated_cases.custom_expected:
- DEIP policy with footprint-1 is matched
- Corresponding logs are shown

updated_cases.title: Verify sending traffic with dedicated and shared with different user
updated_cases.custom_steps:
- Create tenant_footprint.json with two footprint both enabled
- Create DEIP policy with 
      User:bkodirangaiah@netskope.com
      Domain:ifconfig.me
     "egress_ip_type": shared
- Create DEIP policy with 
   User:testuser@netskope.com
   Domain:ifconfig.me
   "egress_ip_type": dedicated, one footprint
- Send traffic to match shared and dedicated policy
- Check that the corresponding IPs are used for sending traffic
updated_cases.custom_expected:
- DEIP policy is matched for different user
- DEIP and VPOP IP are used for corresponding traffic

updated_cases.title: Verify sending traffic with both dedicated and shared with same user
updated_cases.custom_steps:
- Create tenant_footprint.json with two footprint both enabled
- Create DEIP policy with 
      User:testuser@netskope.com
      domain:ifconfig.me
     "egress_ip_type": shared
- Create DEIP policy with 
   User:testuser@netskope.com
   Domain:ifconfig.me
   "egress_ip_type": dedicated, one footprint
- Send traffic to match the policy
- First policy should match and corresponding IP should be used
updated_cases.custom_expected: - First DEIP policy should match and corresponding IP is used

updated_cases.title: Verify creating policy without rule_name
updated_cases.custom_steps:
- Create DEIP policy without rule_name
- dpmgmtsvc should allow creation of the policy
- Webui should restrict this kind of policy creation
updated_cases.custom_expected: dpmgmtsvc should allow creation of policy without rule_name

updated_cases.title: Validate SSL DND traffic with pxc/ep-proxy  Access method; Applied Dedicated EgressIP on Nsproxy ; No change in behavior;  Egress IP policy does NOT match
updated_cases.custom_steps:
- Create Egress IP policy with footprint
- Create SSL DND policy for a domain/category/ supported attribute
- Route the traffic through pxc access method for a domain configured in SSL DND policy and not matching egressIP Policy
- Review that DEI is being applied, REGARDLESS of egressIP policy match or not.
updated_cases.custom_expected:
- Validate DEI is being applied, REGARDLESS of egressIP policy match or not.
- Capture so_mark and user-hash from proxy logs and validate DEI is applied
- Validate SSL DND policy applied and page events generated.

updated_cases.title: Validate Bypass traffic with TCP - Tunnel based bypass for cert pinned app; with FF 'egress-ip-bypass-proxy' Enabled,  Egress IP policy does NOT match
updated_cases.custom_steps:
- Create Egress IP policy with footprint
- Create and add Cert pinned app streeing exception with Tunnel mode bypass for all domains using *
- Enable TENANT based FF 'egress-ip-bypass-proxy'  Existing FF to apply Dedicated EgressIP for Tunel mode Cert pinned app steering exception ( TCP bypass listner).
- Route traffics from ns-client or on proxy with one or more matching attributes [possibly ifconfig.me domain] for cert pinned app
- Review appmodule 3 logs for TCP bypass listner and make sure Dedicated egress IP applied REGARDLESS of egressIP policy match.
- Review appmodule 3 logs to see so_mark is picked
updated_cases.custom_expected:
- Verify Traffic for cert pinned app for Tunnel mode app  works as expcted for end user
- Verify  appmodule 3 logs for TCP bypass listner and make sure Dedicated egress IP applied REGARDLESS of egressIP policy match. [Dev to confirm on this scenario].
- Verify appmodule 3 logs to see so_mark is picked

updated_cases.title: Validate SSL DND traffic with NSClient Access method; Applied Dedicated EgressIP on Nsproxy ; Vpop IP is used when DEI policy is not matched
updated_cases.custom_steps:
Pre-Req: VPOP is enabled
- Create Egress IP policy; with combination of supported attributes
- Create and SSL DND policy for a domain/category/ supported attribute
- Route the traffic through NS-Client for a domain configured in SSL DND policy and not matching egressIP Policy
- Check that VPOP IP is used
updated_cases.custom_expected:
- Validate vpop IP is applied when dei policy is not matched
- Capture so_mark and user-hash from proxy logs and validate DEI is evaluated
- Validate SSL DND policy applied and page events generated.

updated_cases.title: Validate SSL DND traffic with NSClient Access method; Applied Dedicated EgressIP on Nsproxy ; DEIP is used when the policy is matched
updated_cases.custom_steps:
Pre-Req: VPOP is enabled
- Create Egress IP policy; with combination of supported attributes
- Create and SSL DND policy for a domain/category/ supported attribute
- Route the traffic through NS-Client for a domain configured in SSL DND policy and not matching egressIP Policy
- Check that DEIP is used
updated_cases.custom_expected:
- Validate DEIP is applied when dei policy is matched
- Capture so_mark and user-hash from proxy logs and validate DEI is evaluated
- Validate SSL DND policy applied and page events generated.

updated_cases.title: Validate Workflow with IPS enabled + Userhashlb FF disabled , egress IP policy match
updated_cases.custom_steps:
- Enable the IPS FF
- Create an egress IP policy with  supported attribute combinations
- Route the traffic to proxy Matching one of the conditions configured on EgressIP policy
- enable debug logs for httpdump 3 on proxy B
- Review X-NS-FLOW-DATA headers [“egress_policy":"dei"] on proxy B [from IPS to proxy]
- Route multiple traffic flows and verify above behavior and so_mark returned in round robin fashion.
- Review appmodule 3 logs to see so_mark is picked 
- Review policy 1 logs, to see EgressIP policy is being picked and egressIP so_mark is applied.
updated_cases.custom_expected:
- Verify Expected IPS Rule being applied
- In terms of DEIP , look for debug logs to find X-NS-FLOW-DATA headers has [“egress_policy":"dei"] on proxy B; when expected to see DEI applied upon policy match
- If not, “egress_policy":"other"  is added when no egress ip based matched.
- Route multiple traffic flows and verify above behavior and so_mark returned in round robin fashion.

updated_cases.title: Verify pop condition in full egressip policies
updated_cases.custom_steps:
- Create tenant_footprint.json with two footprint both enabled
- Create DEIP policy with 
     "pop": ["HIPPO", "US-SEA1",
    "CO-BOG1"]
     "egress_ip_type": dedicated, one footprint
     
- Create DEIP policy with 
   "pop": ["HIPPO" , "US-SEA1",
    "CO-BOG1"]
  "egress_ip_type": shared
- Send traffic to match the policy
- First policy should match and corresponding IP should be used
updated_cases.custom_expected: - First DEIP policy should match and corresponding IP is used
